title: Zelenskyy, Trump, Merz Hold Talks to Boost US Support for Ukraine Before Putin S
snippets: The talks are aimed at exerting pressure on Trump to back Ukraine more during his summit with Vladimir Putin on Friday.

Volodymyr Zelenskyy will join calls with Trump and Vance in last chance to shape US position before Alaska meeting

Ukraine will not cede land that could be Russian springboard for new
Chancellor Friedrich Merz and several allies will host the president for a video call, the latest in a summer-long effort to hold ranks in supporting Ukraine.
titles: Zelensky and European leaders to hold call with Trump ahead of Putin summit
Leaders in frantic phone diplomacy with Trump ahead of Putin summit on Ukraine – Europe live
Trump Will Discuss Ukraine With European Leaders Ahead of Putin Meeting
summary: Talks involving Volodymyr Zelenskyy, Donald Trump, and Friedrich Merz are being held to urge Trump to strengthen support for Ukraine in his upcoming summit with Vladimir Putin. These discussions are part of a broader effort to maintain international backing for Ukraine against Russian aggression. The talks represent a final attempt to influence the US's stance before Trump's meeting with Putin in Alaska.

title: South Korea Ex-First Lady Arrested on Bribery, Husband Detained for Insurrection
snippets: Investigators say the former president and first lady exerted undue influence on the conservative People Power Party to nominate a specific candidate during a 2022 election.

Kim Keon Hee in custody on three charges while husband Yoon Suk Yeol detained over attempt to impose martial law

South Korea’s former first lady Kim Keon Hee, the wife of the impeached former president Yoon Suk Yeol, has been arrested on corruption charges, a special prosecutor leading a wi

Kim Keon Hee, accused of accepting Chanel bags and other items as bribes, is the only former first lady in the country to have been put behind bars. Her husband has also been jailed on insurrection charges.
titles: Wife of South Korea's jailed ex-President Yoon arrested over corruption allegations
South Korea’s former first lady arrested after court issues warrant on corruption charges
South Korea’s Ex-First Lady Kim Keon Hee Is Arrested on Corruption Charges
summary: South Korea's former first lady, Kim Keon Hee, has been arrested on corruption charges, including accepting bribes such as Chanel bags. Her husband, impeached former president Yoon Suk Yeol, is also detained, facing insurrection charges for attempting to impose martial law. Their arrests are linked to allegations of exerting undue influence on the People Power Party during a 2022 election. Kim Keon Hee is notable as the only former first lady in South Korea to be jailed for such charges.

Richardson's statement follows her recent legal issue, indicating her intention to address and rectify the situation.

titles: Air Canada’s Flight Attendants Plan to Strike from Saturday

summary: Air Canada's flight attendants, numbering over 10,000, have announced a three-day strike starting Saturday after turning down an improved offer from the airline and opting against arbitration. As of now, there has been no update on whether Air Canada and the Canadian Union of Public Employees, representing the flight attendants, have reached an agreement to prevent the impending strike or lockout.

summary: Pete Alonso of the New York Mets hit his 253rd career home run on Tuesday night, surpassing Darryl Strawberry's franchise record that stood for 37 years. Alonso's milestone two-run homer came off Atlanta Braves ace Spencer Strider at Citi Field, setting a new Mets franchise record.

summary: Chinese authorities have directed companies, including ByteDance, TikTok's parent, to prioritize domestic suppliers over foreign ones. Additionally, firms have been advised against using Nvidia's H20 chips, despite Nvidia receiving approval to resume shipments to China. This move reflects China's broader push for technological self-reliance and reduced dependence on foreign technology.

Initially believed to be a sprite, this phenomenon showcases the powerful interactions between thunderstorms and the Earth's atmosphere.

The dispute highlights ongoing tensions between the tech billionaires.

summary: A Martian meteorite sold for a record $5.3 million at Sotheby's New York, raising concerns about its origin and reigniting the debate on ownership of celestial rocks. The auction outcome has led to discussions on the legitimacy of selling extraterrestrial artifacts.

summary: Southern Europe is experiencing scorching temperatures, highlighting the intensification of heatwaves across Europe. Scientists attribute these increasing temperatures directly to climate change, indicating a clear link between the current weather patterns and global environmental changes.

title: New Biodegradable Plastic Breaks Down 2,800 Feet Underwater
titles: Scientists Invent Plastic That Nature Eats 2,800 Feet Underwater
summary: Scientists have developed a new type of plastic that can be naturally decomposed by microbes 2,800 feet underwater. This invention addresses the issue of plastic pollution in the ocean by creating a material that the environment can break down. The successful deployment and testing of this biodegradable plastic provide a promising solution to reduce the impact of plastic waste on marine ecosystems.

title: Clear-Cutting Linked to 18-Fold Increase in Floods Over 40 Years: Study
titles: Clear-Cutting Triggers 18x More Floods, for 40+ Years
summary: Clear-cutting, the process of removing all trees from an area, has been linked to an 18-fold increase in the number of floods for over 40 years, according to a study highlighted by SciTechDaily. This significant rise in flooding events underscores the long-term environmental impact of clear-cutting practices on water management and ecosystem stability.

title: New Earthquake Alert App Launched in Alaska to Save Lives

summary: A new technology, an earthquake alert smartphone app, has been introduced with the potential to save lives in Alaska by providing early warnings before quakes occur. This app aims to give residents crucial seconds to take cover or evacuate hazardous areas, enhancing safety measures in a region prone to seismic activity. The current status of this technology is that it is being implemented with the goal of mitigating the impact of future earthquakes in Alaska.

title: Nighttime Light Exposure Linked to Health Risks, Study Finds
titles: The Surprising Ways Nighttime Light Wrecks Your Brain and Body
summary: Exposure to nighttime light, such as from smartphones and streetlights, can have detrimental effects on both the brain and body, impairing cognitive functions and disrupting sleep patterns. Studies indicate that artificial light at night can alter hormone levels, affecting mood and overall health. The current consensus among researchers emphasizes the importance of minimizing nighttime light exposure to protect against these adverse effects.
